ポップアップ（簡易）チュートリアル
Tutorials Disabled=チュートリアル無効
MORE INFO=より詳しく
EXIT=EXIT
DISABLE TUTORIAL POP-UPS=ポップアップを無効にする
No Spare Clothing=着替えがない
You can't commit murder right now, because you wouldn't be able to change into clean clothes afterwards!=替えの服がないから、今は人を殺せないわ。
Student Councils=生徒会
Be careful around the Student Council girls! You'll get in big trouble if they catch you misbehaving!=生徒会に気を付けて。見つかると厄介なことになるわ。
Teachers=教師
Becareful around teachers! You'll get in big trouble if they catch you misbehaving!=教師に気を付けて。見つかると厄介なことになるわ。
Be careful around teachers! You'll get in big trouble if they catch you misbehaving!=教師に気を付けて。見つかると厄介なことになるわ。
Notes In Lockers=下駄箱の手紙
It's possible to leave a note in a student's locker to lure them somewhere!=下駄箱に手紙を入れて、生徒を呼び出すことが出来るわ。
Police=警察
The cops are on their way to school! Hurry and dispose of any evidence that links you to a crime!=警察が学校に向かっているわ。急いで証拠を処分しなさい。
Your Senpai=センパイ
You lose control of yourself around Senpai! Be careful, don't let him see you acting weird!=あなたはセンパイの近くでは平常心を保てない。彼に怪しまれることは避けなさい。
Yandere Vision=ヤンデレビジョン
You can use "Yandere Vision" to identify objects that can help you get away with crimes!=ヤンデレビジョンによって、使える道具を見つけ出すことができるわ。
Weapons=武器
You are now holding a dangerous weapon! Don't let anyone see you with this!=危険物を持っているわね。誰にも見られないようにしなさい。
Restoring Sanity=正気度の回復
Your sanity is very low right now! If anyone see you like this, your reputation will go down!=狂気に満ちているわね。誰かに見られると評判が下がってしまうわ。
Your sanity is very low right now! If anyone sees you like this, your reputation will go down!=正気を失っているわね。誰かに見られたら評判が下がってしまうわ。
Bloody Clothing=血のついた服
Your clothing is covered in blood! You'll need to change into clean clothes!=服が血まみれね。綺麗な服に着替えなさい。
Attending Class=授業
It's almost time for class! Don't be late!=もうすぐ授業が始まるわ。遅刻しないようにね。
Taking Photographs=写真
If you take a photo of a student with your smartphone, you can learn information about them!=生徒の顔を撮ったら、その生徒について教えてあげるわ。
Joining Clubs=部活動
You're nearby a clubroom! If you talk to the club leader, you can join this club!=そこは部室よ。部長と話せば入部できるわ。
Info-chan's Services=インフォちゃんのサービス
Why are you snooping around outside of my room? Go away!=私の部屋の前で何をしているの？離れなさい！
Cleaning Blood=血痕の掃除
There is now a pool of blood at school. Clean it up before someone sees it!=血痕があるわ。見られる前に片づけなさい。
Reputation=評判
If people see you misbehaving, they will gossip about you! This can lead to a Game Over!=不審な行動を見られると悪い噂が広がって、ゲームオーバーに繋がるわ。
Getting Money=お金を得る
You don't have enough money to buy that!=お金が足りないようね。
Causing Distractions=Causando Distrações
Use distractions to direct attention away from yourself!=頼みごとをすることで注意をそらすことができます！
詳細説明
RETURN=戻る
EXIT=EXIT
No Spare Clothing=着替えがない
There is a limited number of clean outfits in the school. If there are no more clean outfits remaining, you will not have the option of attacking anyone with a weapon.=校内にある服には限りがあるわ。替えの服が無くなったら、武器を使って誰かを襲うのはやめなさい。
Fortunately, if you need to obtain a spare school uniform fast, I'm here to help you.=そういうときのために、私のサービスがあるわ。
Use your smartphone to access my app, and then open the "Drops" menu. You can use that menu to obtain a clean uniform from me...in exchange for some panty shots, of course.=インフォちゃんのアプリを開いて「ドロップ」のメニューを見なさい。そこから選べば、新品の制服をあげるわ。もちろん、ポイントと引き換えにね。
For future reference, it's possible to order a spare school uniform by using your computer at home. You also might be able to find someone in the Sewing Room who can make a spare uniform for you.=他の手段として、あなたの家のパソコンから予備の制服を買うこともできるわ。もしくは、裁縫室に予備の制服を作ってくれる子がいるかもね。
There is a limited number of clean outfits in the school. If there are no more clean outfits remaining, you will not have the option of attacking anyone with a weapon. \n\n Fortunately, if you need to obtain a spare school uniform fast, I'm here to help you. \n\n Use your smartphone to access my app, and then open the "Drops" menu. You can use that menu to obtain a clean uniform from me...in exchange for some info points, of course. \n\n For future reference, it's possible to order a spare school uniform by using your computer at home. You also might be able to find someone in the Sewing Room who can make a spare uniform for you.=校内にある服には限りがあるわ。替えの服が無くなったら、武器を使って誰かを襲うのはやめなさい。\n\nそういうときのために、私のサービスがあるわ。\n\nインフォちゃんのアプリを開いて「ドロップ」のメニューを見なさい。そこから選べば、新品の制服をあげるわ。もちろん、ポイントと引き換えにね。\n\n他の手段として、あなたの家のパソコンから予備の制服を買うこともできるわ。もしくは、裁縫室に予備の制服を作ってくれる子がいるかもね。
Student Council=生徒会
The four young women waring white blazers are the Student Council. I don't know the reason why, but apparently, they are very suspicious of you.=白いブレザーを着ているのが生徒会よ。どうしてか、あなたをとても疑っているようね。
If they catch you doing anything sketchy, they'll send you to the guidance councelor right away, so be careful around them.=彼女らに怪しい行動を見られるとカウンセラー送りにされるわ。十分に気を付けることね。
They are authorized to carry pepper spray for self-defense, and will whip it out in an instant if they feel threatened. It's best to stay away from them. =彼女らは護身用の催涙スプレーを持っていて、危害を加えられそうになると使ってくるわ。むやみに近づかないようにね。
The Student Council President has strong personal feelings for each of them, so if you harm any of them, there will probably be severe consequences...=生徒会長は彼女らをとても大事にしているから、危害を加えると大変なことになるでしょうね。
The four young women wearing white blazers are the Student Council. I don't know the reason why, but apparently, they are very suspicious of you. \n\n If they catch you doing anything sketchy, they'll send you to the guidance counselor right away, so be very careful around them. \n\n They are authorized to carry pepper spray for self-defense, and will whip it out in an instant if they feel threatened. It's best to stay away from them. \n\n The Student Council President has strong personal feelings for each of them, so if you harm any of them, there will probably be severe consequences...=白いブレザーを着ているのが生徒会よ。どうしてか、あなたをとても疑っているようね。\n\n彼女らに怪しい行動を見られるとカウンセラー送りにされるわ。十分に気を付けることね。\n\n彼女らは護身用の催涙スプレーを持っていて、危害を加えられそうになると使ってくるわ。むやみに近づかないようにね。\n\n生徒会長は彼女らをとても大事にしているから、危害を加えると大変なことになるでしょうね。
Teachers=教師
If a teacher catches you braking school rules, you'll be sent to the guidance counselor, where you will have to explain your actions. This can result in a suspension or an expulsion, so aviod it.=教師に校則違反を見られると、カウンセラー送りになるわ。したことの説明を求められるけど、ことによっては停学や退学になるわ。
If teacher sees you commit murder, she'll try to apprehend you. If you've upgraded your Physical Education stat and have a small weapon, you can try to fight back, but it'll be difficult.=もし殺人現場を見られたら、取り押さえに来るわ。対抗できるくらいの体育スキルと隠し持っている武器があれば、反撃することもできるわ。
By the way...for decades, the Headmaster of Akademi has been paranoid that one day a psychopath may go on a killing spree in his school, so he requires all faculty to undergo martial arts training.=ところで、校長は数十年前から、殺人鬼が学内で突然暴れだすかもしれないという妄想に囚われているようね。それで、すべての教師に自己防衛の訓練を受けさせているわ。
Just thought you'd like to know that.=知っておいたほうがいいかもね。
If a teacher catches you breaking school rules, you'll be sent to the guidance counselor, where you will have to explain your actions. This can result in a suspension or an expulsion, so avoid it. \n\n If a teacher sees you commit murder, she'll try to apprehend you. If you've upgraded your Physical Education stat and have a small weapon, you can try to fight back, but it'll be difficult. \n\n By the way...for decades, the Headmaster of Akademi has been paranoid that one day a psychopath may go on a killing spree in his school, so he requires all faculty to undergo martial arts training. \n\n Just thought you'd like to know that.=教師に校則違反を見られると、カウンセラー送りになるわ。したことの説明を求められるけど、ことによっては停学や退学になるわ。\nもし殺人現場を見られたら、取り押さえに来るわ。対抗できるくらいの体育スキルと隠し持っている武器があれば、反撃することもできるわ。\nところで、校長は数十年前から、殺人鬼が学内で突然暴れだすかもしれないという妄想に囚われているようね。それで、すべての教師に自己防衛の訓練を受けさせているわ。\n知っておいたほうがいいかもね。
Notes In Lockers=下駄箱の手紙
To lure a student away from any potential witnesses, you can leave a note in their locker and convince them to meet you somewhere for a private conversation.=人目を避けたいなら、下駄箱に手紙を入れて、内緒の話がしたいと誘い出せばいいわ。
To find a student's locker, you must consult a piece of paper hanging on one of the pillars in the locker area. If you have taken a picture of that student's face and sent their picture to me, you will be able to find their locker by checking that piece of paper.=生徒の下駄箱の場所を知るには、下駄箱の近くの柱にある張り紙を調べるといいわ。調べたい生徒がいたら、顔写真を撮って私に送ってね。
If you want a student to take your note seriously, you will have to write about a subject that they care about. Consider their personality and their interests when leaving a note for them.=手紙を読んでもらうためには、その生徒が興味を持つ話題を書くべきよ。生徒の性格や関心をよく考えることね。
Some students will check their locker once per day, and other students will check twice per day. To make a student deviate from their daily routine to go check their locker, start a conversation with them and tell them that you saw someone leave a note in their locker.=いつ手紙を見るかは、生徒によって違うわ。普段の行動パターンと関係なく手紙を見てもらいたければ、その子に話しかけて、下駄箱に誰かが手紙を入れていたと伝えるといいわ。
To lure a student away from any potential witnesses, you can leave a note in their locker and convince them to meet you somewhere for a private conversation. \n\n To find a student's locker, you must consult a piece of paper hanging on one of the pillars in the locker area. If you have taken a picture of that student's face and sent their picture to me, you will be able to find their locker by checking that piece of paper. \n\n If you want a student to take your note seriously, you will have to write about a subject that they care about. Consider their personality and their interests when leaving a note for them. \n\n Some students will check their locker once per day, and other students will check twice per day. To make a student deviate from their daily routine to go check their locker, start a conversation with them and tell them that you saw someone leave a note in their locker.=人目を避けたいなら、下駄箱に手紙を入れて、内緒の話がしたいと誘い出せばいいわ。\n生徒の下駄箱の場所を知るには、下駄箱の近くの柱にある張り紙を調べるといいわ。調べたい生徒がいたら、顔写真を撮って私に送ってね。\n手紙を読んでもらうためには、その生徒が興味を持つ話題を書くべきよ。生徒の性格や関心をよく考えることね。\nいつ手紙を見るかは、生徒によって違うわ。普段の行動パターンと関係なく手紙を見てもらいたければ、その子に話しかけて、下駄箱に誰かが手紙を入れていたと伝えるといいわ。
Police=警察
If someone calls the cops, it will take them about 5 minutes to arrive at school. If they find evidence that links you to a crime, you're going to jail. To avoid this, you need to destroy anything that connects you to a murder.=誰かが通報してから5分たつと、警察が学校に到着するわ。あなたが殺人を犯したという証拠が見つかれば逮捕されてしまうわ。そうならないように、証拠となるものはすべて処分しなさい。
You can dispose of corpses using the incinerator or the gardening club's woodchipper. To use the woodchipper, you'll have to attach a bucket to it to catch the blood that is going to spill out.=死体の処分には、焼却炉や園芸部にある粉砕機を使うといいわ。粉砕機を使うには、出てくる血を受け止めるバケツが必要よ。
At the top-left corner of the screen, you can see a timer showing you how much time remains until the police arrive, along with a checklist of all the evidence you still need to dispose of.=画面の左上を見れば、警察が到着するまでの時間と、証拠を処分したかどうかを確認できるわ。
If someone calls the cops, it will take them about 5 minutes to arrive at school. If they find evidence that links you to a crime, you're going to jail. To avoid this, you need to destroy anything that connects you to a murder. \n\n You can dispose of bloody clothing and bloody weapons using the outdoor incinerator at the northwest corner of the school. Don't forget to mop up any pools of blood and restore any lost sanity. \n\n You can dispose of corpses using the incinerator or the gardening club's woodchipper. To use the woodchipper, you'll have to attach a bucket to it to catch the blood that is going to spill out. \n\n At the top-left corner of the screen, you can see a timer showing you how much time remains until the police arrive, along with a checklist of all the evidence you still need to dispose of.=誰かが通報してから5分たつと、警察が学校に到着するわ。あなたが殺人を犯したという証拠が見つかれば逮捕されてしまうわ。そうならないように、証拠となるものはすべて処分しなさい。\n死体の処分には、焼却炉や園芸部にある粉砕機を使うといいわ。粉砕機を使うには、出てくる血を受け止めるバケツが必要よ。\n画面の左上を見れば、警察が到着するまでの時間と、証拠を処分したかどうかを確認できるわ。
Your Senpai=センパイ
Your feelings for your Senpai are so strong that you lose control of yourself around him.=センパイへの想いが強すぎるせいで、センパイの近くではあなたは平常心を保てない。
If you get too close to your Senpai, you will drop any items that you are holding and begin fidgeting nervously.=センパイに近づきすぎると、手に持っているものを落とし、どきどきし、落ち着きが無くなるわ。
In this state, you look pretty weird, so Senpai will get creeped out if he sees you like this.=センパイがそれを見たら、不審に思って、気味悪がるでしょうね。
If you make a bad impression on Senpai, your heart will break, and you'll get a game over. Don't let him see you acting weird...or stained with blood, or carrying a weapon, or disposing of a corpse, etc.=センパイの印象が悪くなれば、失恋してしまうわ。彼に不審な行為を見られないようにね。例えば、血まみれの姿、危険物の運搬、死体の処分なんかよ。
Your feelings for your Senpai are so strong that you lose control of yourself around him. \n\n If you get too close to your Senpai, you will drop any items that you are holding and begin fidgeting nervously. \n\n In this state, you look pretty weird, so Senpai will get creeped out if he sees you like this. \n\n If you make a bad impression on Senpai, your heart will break, and you'll get a game over. Don't let him see you acting weird...or stained with blood, or carrying a weapon, or disposing of a corpse, etc.=センパイに近づきすぎると、手に持っているものを落とし、どきどきし、落ち着きが無くなるわ。\nセンパイがそれを見たら、不審に思って、気味悪がるでしょうね。\nセンパイの印象が悪くなれば、失恋してしまうわ。彼に不審な行為を見られないようにね。例えば、血まみれの姿、危険物の運搬、死体の処分なんかよ。
Yandere Vision=ヤンデレビジョン
A normal person doesn't walk around school looking for murder tools...but you're not a normal person.=普通の人は学校内で武器を探したりしないわ。でもあなたは普通じゃない。
You see the world differently from other people. You have "Yandere Vision", which is activated by holding down the left CTRL key (or the RB button if you're using a gamepad).=左CTRLキー（もしくはゲームパッドのRBボタン）を押しっぱなしにして、ヤンデレビジョンを発動させれば、普通とは違う世界が見えるわ。
When Yandere Vision is active, important things will be highlighted. For example, an object that can be used for murder (or cleaning up evidence of a crime) will be highlighted in cyan.=ヤンデレビジョンの中では、重要なものが光って見えるわ。例えば、殺人や証拠の処分に使えるものは青く光るわ。
A person with a green outline is a friend. A person with a yellow outline has seen you do something suspicious, and plans to gossip about you. A person with a red outline has seen you commit murder, and potentially give you a game over.=緑色に見える人は友達、黄色く見える人はあなたを不審に思って、噂を広めようとしている人よ。 赤く見える人はあなたの殺人の目撃者、放っておくとゲームオーバーかもね。
A normal person doesn't walk around school looking for murder tools...but you're not a normal person. \n\n You see the world differently from other people. You have "Yandere Vision", which is activated by holding down the left CTRL key (or the RB button if you're using a gamepad). \n\n When Yandere Vision is active, important things will be highlighted. For example, an object that can be used for murder (or cleaning up evidence of a crime) will be highlighted in cyan. \n\n A person with a green outline is a friend. A person with a yellow outline has seen you do something suspicious, and plans to gossip about you. A person with a red outline has seen you commit murder, and can potentially give you a game over.=普通の人は学校内で武器を探したりしないわ。でもあなたは普通じゃない。\n左CTRLキー（もしくはゲームパッドのRBボタン）を押しっぱなしにして、ヤンデレビジョンを発動させれば、普通とは違う世界が見えるわ。\nヤンデレビジョンの中では、重要なものが光って見えるわ。例えば、殺人や証拠の処分に使えるものは青く光るわ。\n緑色に見える人は友達、黄色く見える人はあなたを不審に思って、噂を広めようとしている人よ。 赤く見える人はあなたの殺人の目撃者、放っておくとゲームオーバーかもね。
Weapons=武器
There are various objects around school that can be used as weapons. Some look harmless, but others look suspicious. If you're spotted carrying a suspicious object, you're reputation will be damaged.=校内には、武器になるものがたくさんあるわ。その中には、見られても気にされないものと、不自然に思われるものがあるわ。不自然に思われてしまうと、あなたの評判が落ちるわ。
There are two types of weapons: long and short. You can conceal a maximum of two short weapons under your clothing, but you can't conceal a long weapon.=武器は、大きなものと小さなものに分けられるわ。小さな武器は2つまで隠し持つことができるけど、大きな武器は隠し持つことはできないわ。
If a student or faculty member tries to apprehend you, you can only fight back if you're carrying a short weapon in your hands.=生徒や教職員が捕らえに来た時に反撃するには、小さな武器を持っていないといけないわ。
On keyboard: To unequip a weapon or drop an object, press the "1" key. To swap between your first and second weapon, press the "2" and "3" keys. To drop a weapon, hold down the "2" key or the "3" key. On controller: use the D-pad to equip or drop weapons.=キーボードなら、1キーで武器を隠したり持ち物を手放したりできるわ。2キーと3キーで持っている武器を切り替えられて、長押しで手放すこともできるわ。コントローラーなら、十字キーでこれらの操作ができるわ。
There are various objects around school that can be used as weapons. Some look harmless, but others look suspicious. If you're spotted carrying a suspicious object, your reputation will be damaged. \n\n There are two types of weapons: long and short. You can conceal a maximum of two short weapons under your clothing, but you can't conceal a long weapon. \n\n If a student or faculty member tries to apprehend you, you can only fight back if you're carrying a short weapon in your hands. \n\n On keyboard: To unequip a weapon or drop an object, press the "1" key. To swap between your first and second weapon, press the "2" and "3" keys. To drop a weapon, hold down the "2" key or the "3" key. On controller: use the D-pad to equip or drop weapons.=校内には、武器になるものがたくさんあるわ。その中には、見られても気にされないものと、不自然に思われるものがあるわ。不自然に思われてしまうと、あなたの評判が落ちるわ。\n武器は、大きなものと小さなものに分けられるわ。小さな武器は2つまで隠し持つことができるけど、大きな武器は隠し持つことはできないわ。\n生徒や教職員が捕らえに来た時に反撃するには、小さな武器を持っていないといけないわ。\nキーボードなら、1キーで武器を隠したり持ち物を手放したりできるわ。2キーと3キーで持っている武器を切り替えられて、長押しで手放すこともできるわ。コントローラーなら、十字キーでこれらの操作ができるわ。
Restring Sanity=正気度の回復
Performing certain actions - like murder - will cause damage to your sanity. When your sanity is low, anyone who sees you will get scared, and will damage your reputation by gossiping about you.=特定の行動をすると、正気を少し失うわ。正気度が低くなると、あなたを見た人に不審に思われ、評判が下がってしまうわ。
You can monitor your sanity by looking at the cardiograph at the bottom-right corner of the screen. When itturns red, you are visibly insane.=正気度は画面の右下にある心拍計で確認できるわ。赤くなっているなら、あなたは狂って見えるということよ。
To restore your sanity, you'll need to release your feelings. The best way to do this is with laughter. Mash the left CTRL key (or the RB button on your gamepad) to restore sanity. But be careful not to let anyone see you do this, bacause evil laughter  will cause people to become frightened of you.=正気を取り戻すなら、大声で笑って、感情を解き放つのが一番よ。左CTRLキー（もしくはゲームパッドのRBボタン）を連打すると、笑って正気度が回復するわ。でも、狂ったように笑う姿を人に見られたら、不審に思われてしまうから注意しなさい。
There are also other ways to restore sanity, such as taking apicture of your beloved Senpai and then using it from the Photo Gallery menu.=それ以外には、あなたの愛しのセンパイの写真を使っても正気度を回復できるわ。
Performing certain actions - like murder - will cause damage to your sanity. When your sanity is low, anyone who sees you will get scared, and will damage your reputation by gossiping about you. \n\n You can monitor your sanity by looking at the cardiograph at the bottom-right corner of the screen. When it turns red, you are visibly insane. \n\n To restore your sanity, you'll need to release your feelings. The best way to do this is with laughter. Mash the left CTRL key (or the RB button on your gamepad) to restore sanity. But be careful not to let anyone see you do this, because evil laughter will cause people to become frightened of you. \n\n There are also other ways to restore sanity, such as taking a picture of your beloved Senpai and then using it from the Photo Gallery menu.=特定の行動をすると、正気を少し失うわ。正気度が低くなると、あなたを見た人に不審に思われ、評判が下がってしまうわ。\n正気度は画面の右下にある心拍計で確認できるわ。赤くなっているなら、あなたは狂って見えるということよ。\n正気を取り戻すなら、大声で笑って、感情を解き放つのが一番よ。左CTRLキー（もしくはゲームパッドのRBボタン）を連打すると、笑って正気度が回復するわ。でも、狂ったように笑う姿を人に見られたら、不審に思われてしまうから注意しなさい。\nそれ以外には、あなたの愛しのセンパイの写真を使っても正気度を回復できるわ。
Bloody Clothing=血の付いた服
If your clothing gets splashed with blood, you will look like a murderer. It will frighten people around you, and could get you in trouble with the faculty.=服が血で汚れていると、殺人者だと思われてしまうわ。周囲の人をぞっとさせ、教師に見つかると咎められるでしょうね。
You must go to the shower building behind the school, strip off your clothing, take a shower, and change into a clean outfit.=校舎の外にあるシャワールームに行って、汚れた服を脱ぎ、シャワーを浴び、綺麗な服に着替えなさい。
After you've switched into some clean clothing, you should probably dump the bloody clothing into the outdoor incinerator at the northwest corner of the school.=服を着替えたら、汚れた服は、校舎の北西にある焼却炉で処分しなさい。
If you need a spare uniform, you can purchase one from me using the "Drops" menu accessed from the pause screen.=新品の制服が必要なら、インフォちゃんのアプリの「ドロップ」メニューから私に注文することもできるわ。
If your clothing gets splashed with blood, you will look like a murderer. It will frighten the people around you, and could get you in trouble with the faculty. \n\n You must go to the shower building behind the school, strip off your clothing, take a shower, and change into a clean outfit. \n\n After you've switched into some clean clothing, you should probably dump the bloody clothing into the outdoor incinerator at the northwest corner of the school. \n\n If you need a spare uniform, you can purchase one from me using the "Drops" menu accessed from the pause screen.=服が血で汚れていると、殺人者だと思われてしまうわ。周囲の人をぞっとさせ、教師に見つかると咎められるでしょうね。\n校舎の外にあるシャワールームに行って、汚れた服を脱ぎ、シャワーを浴び、綺麗な服に着替えなさい。\n服を着替えたら、汚れた服は、校舎の北西にある焼却炉で処分しなさい。\n新品の制服が必要なら、インフォちゃんのアプリの「ドロップ」メニューから私に注文することもできるわ。
Attending Class=授業
Class begins at 8:30 AM and 1:30 PM. You will hear a bell ring when it's time for class. You can head to class early in order to advance time more quickly.=8時30分と13時30分にチャイムが鳴り、授業が始まるわ。早く席に着けば、その分もまとめて時間を飛ばすことができるわ。
Attending class allows you to invest "Study Points" into various stats so youcan gain new abilities.=授業を受けるとスタディポイントがもらえるわ。それを使うことで、新しい能力が身につくわ。
Being late for class will reduce the number of study points you can use. Being late will also damage your reputation, which can eventually lead to a game over.=授業に遅刻すると、もらえるポイントが減るうえに、評判が下がり、ゲームオーバーに繋がるわ。
To spawn a trail that leads to class, press on the "T" key on your keybard (or click in the left stick on your gamepad).=Tキー（もしくはゲームパッドの左スティック）を押せば、教室までの道を確認できるわ。
Class begins at 8:30 AM and 1:30 PM. You will hear a bell ring when it's time for class. You can head to class early in order to advance time more quickly. \n\n Attending class allows you to invest "Study Points" into various stats so that you can gain new abilities. \n\n Being late for class will reduce the number of study points you can use. Being late will also damage your reputation, which can eventually lead to a game over. \n\n To spawn a trail that leads to class, press the "T" key on your keyboard (or click in the left stick on your gamepad).=8時30分と13時30分にチャイムが鳴り、授業が始まるわ。早く席に着けば、その分もまとめて時間を飛ばすことができるわ。\n授業を受けるとスタディポイントがもらえるわ。それを使うことで、新しい能力が身につくわ。\n授業に遅刻すると、もらえるポイントが減るうえに、評判が下がり、ゲームオーバーに繋がるわ。\nTキー（もしくはゲームパッドの左スティック）を押せば、教室までの道を確認できるわ。
Taking Photographs=写真を撮る
There are 89 students in this school with you. some of them are potential threats, and some of them might be useful tools. It's in your best interest to learn everything you can about the school's population.=この学校には、あなた以外に89人の生徒がいるわ。中には邪魔になる子もいるし、利用できる子もいるわ。生徒について知っておくときっと便利よ。
If you send me a picture of someone's face, I'll provide you with all the information I have about them; their name, their personality, their level of strength, and even their dairy routine.=顔写真を撮って私に送れば、その生徒の名前、性格、自衛力、行動など、知る限りの情報を提供するわ。
To aim your camera, hold down the right mouse button (or the left trigger, if you're using a gamepad). To take a picture, click the left mouse button (or the right trigger). Then check the bottom of the screen to see your option.=右クリック（もしくはゲームパッドの左トリガー）を押し続けるとカメラを構えて、そのまま左クリック（もしくは右トリガー）で写真が撮れるわ。撮った写真をどうするかは、画面下のオプションで確認してね。
Some students are friendly and eager to pose for a photo, but other students are anti-social and won't appreciate you sticking a camera in their face. Be careful, or you might irritate people.=ポーズを取ってくれる子もいれば、カメラを嫌がる子もいるわ。あまり困らせないようにね。
There are 89 students in this school with you. Some of them are potential threats, and some of them might be useful tools. It's in your best interest to learn everything you can about the school's population. \n\n If you send me a picture of someone's face, I'll provide you with all the information I have about them; their name, their personality, their level of strength, and even their daily routine. \n\n To aim your camera, hold down the right mouse button (or the left trigger, if you're using a gamepad). To take a picture, click the left mouse button (or the right trigger). Then check the bottom of the screen to see your options. \n\n Some students are friendly and eager to pose for a photo, but other students are anti-social and won't appreciate you sticking a camera in their face. Be careful, or you might irritate people.=この学校には、あなた以外に89人の生徒がいるわ。中には邪魔になる子もいるし、利用できる子もいるわ。生徒について知っておくときっと便利よ。\n顔写真を撮って私に送れば、その生徒の名前、性格、自衛力、行動など、知る限りの情報を提供するわ。\n右クリック（もしくはゲームパッドの左トリガー）を押し続けるとカメラを構えて、そのまま左クリック（もしくは右トリガー）で写真が撮れるわ。撮った写真をどうするかは、画面下のオプションで確認してね。\nポーズを取ってくれる子もいれば、カメラを嫌がる子もいるわ。あまり困らせないようにね。
Joining Clubs=部活動
There are 10 clubs to join at Akademi HIgh. Each club offers you some sort of benefit, so it's your interest to join a club.=この学校には10の部活があるわ。部活に入ると色々な恩恵があるから、ぜひ入ってみるといいわ。
To join a club, speak to a club leader when they are nearby their club. You can identify a club leader by their red armband. (The Student Council girls won't let you join their "club", though.)=部長と話せば入部することができるわ。赤い腕章が目印よ。ただし、生徒会には入れてもらえないわ。
If a club has less than 5 members (including you) then it will shut down permanently, and you will never be able to benefit from that club. So, it wouldn't be unwise to anyone who belongs to a club.=あなたを含めて部員が4人以下になるとその部は閉鎖され、恩恵も受けられなくなるわ。部活動に入っている生徒を排除するのはやめておきなさい。
If a club leader holds a grudge against you, they will never let you join their club...so you probably souldn't let them catch you sticking a knife into someone's eye sockets.=部長の反感を買うと、入部できなくなるわ。誰かを排除するところを見られないようにしなさい。
There are 10 clubs to join at Akademi High. Each club offers you some sort of benefit, so it's in your best interest to join a club. \n\n To join a club, speak to a club leader when they are nearby their club. You can identify a club leader by their red armband. (The Student Council girls won't let you join their "club", though.) \n\n If a club has less than 5 members (including you) then it will shut down permanently, and you will never be able to benefit from that club. So, it would be unwise to kill anyone who belongs to a club. \n\n If a club leader holds a grudge against you, they will never let you join their club...so you probably shouldn't let them catch you sticking a knife into someone's eye socket.=この学校には10の部活があるわ。部活に入ると色々な恩恵があるから、ぜひ入ってみるといいわ。\n部長と話せば入部することができるわ。赤い腕章が目印よ。ただし、生徒会には入れてもらえないわ。\nあなたを含めて部員が4人以下になるとその部は閉鎖され、恩恵も受けられなくなるわ。部活動に入っている生徒を排除するのはやめておきなさい。\n部長の反感を買うと、入部できなくなるわ。誰かを排除するところを見られないようにしなさい。
There are 10 clubs to join in this school. Each club offers you some sort of benefit, so it's in your best interest to join a club. \n\n To join a club, speak to a club leader when they are nearby their club. You can identify a club leader by their red armband. (The Student Council girls won't let you join their "club", though.) \n\n If a club has less than 5 members (including you) then it will shut down permanently, and you will never be able to benefit from that club. So, it would be unwise to kill anyone who belongs to a club. \n\n If a club leader holds a grudge against you, they will never let you join their club...so you probably shouldn't let them catch you sticking a knife into someone's eye socket.=この学校には10の部活があるわ。部活に入ると色々な恩恵があるから、ぜひ入ってみるといいわ。\n部長と話せば入部することができるわ。赤い腕章が目印よ。ただし、生徒会には入れてもらえないわ。\nあなたを含めて部員が4人以下になるとその部は閉鎖され、恩恵も受けられなくなるわ。部活動に入っている生徒を排除するのはやめておきなさい。\n部長の反感を買うと、入部できなくなるわ。誰かを排除するところを見られないようにしなさい。
Info-chan's Services=インフォちゃんのサービス
Yes, I'm somewhere in school with you...but don't even bother trying to find me; my fortress is impregnable.=私はこの学校のどこかにいるわ。けれど、探そうとしても無駄よ。固く閉ざされているから。
In case you forgotten, I can assist you in a variety of ways. If you pause the game and access the Info-chan app, you'll see that I offer "Schemes", "Services", "Drops", and "Bounties".=忘れないで。私はあなたに協力すると言ったわ。あなたのスマホからインフォちゃんのアプリを開いて、「ガイド」「サービス」「ドロップ」「依頼」から選んでね。
"Schemes" are walkthroughs that will guide you towards a specific goal. "Drops" are items that I can provide by dropping them behind the school. "Services" come in a very wide variety; check them out.=「ガイド」からは、目的を達成する手順を教えてあげるわ。「ドロップ」は、校舎裏に必要なものを落としてあげるわ。「サービス」はいろいろあるから、見ておいてね。
There are multiple ways to pay for my services. Photograph faces, photograph panties, Plase covert listening devices in certain locations, give me stolen phones, or complete my bounties.=サービスを受けるには対価が必要よ。顔写真・パンツの写真、盗聴器の設置、スマホを盗んでくる、「依頼」をこなす、があるわ。
Yes, I'm somewhere in school with you...but don't even bother trying to find me; my fortress is impregnable. \n\n In case you've forgotten, I can assist you in a variety of ways. If you pause the game and access the Info-chan app, you'll see that I offer "Schemes", "Services", "Drops", and "Bounties". \n\n "Schemes" are walkthroughs that will guide you towards a specific goal. "Drops" are items that I can provide by dropping them behind the school. "Services" come in a very wide variety; check them out. \n\n There are multiple ways to pay for my services. Photograph faces, photograph panties, place covert listening devices in certain locations, give me stolen phones, or complete my bounties.=私はこの学校のどこかにいるわ。けれど、探そうとしても無駄よ。固く閉ざされているから。\n忘れないで。私はあなたに協力すると言ったわ。あなたのスマホからインフォちゃんのアプリを開いて、「ガイド」「サービス」「ドロップ」「依頼」から選んでね。\n「ガイド」からは、目的を達成する手順を教えてあげるわ。「ドロップ」は、校舎裏に必要なものを落としてあげるわ。「サービス」はいろいろあるから、見ておいてね。\nサービスを受けるには対価が必要よ。顔写真・パンツの写真、盗聴器の設置、スマホを盗んでくる、「依頼」をこなす、があるわ。
Cleaning Blood=血痕の掃除
If you kill a someone with a sharp weapon, their corpes will leak blood. Anyone who sees blood is going to freak out and tell a teacher about it, which will result in the police coming to school.=鋭利な武器で人を殺せば、血が流れるわ。血を見た生徒は教師に報告し、警察を呼ばれるわ。
To prevent that, you need to clean up the blood. Get a bucket, fill it with water, add bleach, dip a mop into the bleached water, and use the mop to clean up the blood.=そうならないように、血痕は消すことね。バケツに水と漂白剤を入れて、モップを濡らして、血痕を拭き取りなさい。
You should also consider disposing of the corpse by dragging or carrying it to the outdoor incinerator at the northwest corner of the school.=そして、校舎の北西にある焼却炉で死体を処分するべきね。
If you're having trouble locating blood pools, hold down the left CTRL key (or the RB button if you're using a gamepad) to activate Yandere Vision, which will highlight blood pools for you.=左CTRLキー（もしくはゲームパッドのRBボタン）を押しっぱなしにして、ヤンデレビジョンを発動させれば、残った血痕が光って見えるわ。
If you kill someone with a sharp weapon, their corpses will leak blood. Anyone who sees the blood is going to freak out and tell a teacher about it, which will result in the police coming to school. \n\n To prevent that, you need to clean up the blood. Get a bucket, fill it with water, add bleach, dip a mop into the bleached water, and use the mop to clean up the blood. \n\n You should also consider disposing of the corpse by dragging or carrying it to the outdoor incinerator at the northwest corner of the school. \n\n If you're having trouble locating blood pools, hold down the Left CTRL key (or the RB button if you're using a gamepad) to activate Yandere Vision, which will highlight blood pools for you.=鋭利な武器で人を殺せば、血が流れるわ。血を見た生徒は教師に報告し、警察を呼ばれるわ。\nそうならないように、血痕は消すことね。バケツに水と漂白剤を入れて、モップを濡らして、血痕を拭き取りなさい。\nそして、校舎の北西にある焼却炉で死体を処分するべきね。\n左CTRLキー（もしくはゲームパッドのRBボタン）を押しっぱなしにして、ヤンデレビジョンを発動させれば、残った血痕が光って見えるわ。
Reputation=評判
If you are spotted doing something suspicious, the person who spotted you is going to gossip about you and damage your reputation.=不審な行動を見られると、悪い噂を流されて、評判が下がってしまうわ。
You can see your current reputation at the bottom-left corner of the screen. The white bar is your current reputation. The pink number represents how reputation is going to change the next time that students gather to gosisp.（原文ママ）=評判は画面の左下で確認できるわ。白いバーが今の評価、ピンクの数字は次の噂が広がる時間帯に変わる評判を表しているわ。
You can recover lost reputation by talking to people who witnessed you and apologizing to them. You can also improve your reputation by complementing people or doing "Tasks" for them.=人に見られても、謝ることで評判を取り戻すことができるわ。生徒と会話したり、頼み事を聞いたりすることでも評判を上げることができるわ。
If you lose too much reputation, everyone in school will look down on you - incluidng your beloved Senpai. this will result in a game over, so take good care of your reputation.=評判が下がりすぎると、あらゆる生徒、もちろんセンパイからも見下され、ゲームオーバーになるわ。気をつけなさい。
If you are spotted doing something suspicious, the person who spotted you is going to gossip about you and damage your reputation. \n\n You can see your current reputation at the bottom-left corner of the screen. The white bar is your current reputation. The pink number represents how your reputation is going to change the next time that students gather to gossip. \n\n You can recover lost reputation by talking to people who witnessed you and apologizing to them. You can also improve your reputation by complimenting people or doing "Tasks" for them. \n\n If you lose too much reputation, everyone in school will look down on you - including your beloved Senpai. This will result in a game over, so take good care of your reputation.=不審な行動を見られると、悪い噂を流されて、評判が下がってしまうわ。\n評判は画面の左下で確認できるわ。白いバーが今の評価、ピンクの数字は次の噂が広がる時間帯に変わる評判を表しているわ。\n人に見られても、謝ることで評判を取り戻すことができるわ。生徒と会話したり、頼み事を聞いたりすることでも評判を上げることができるわ。\n評判が下がりすぎると、あらゆる生徒、もちろんセンパイからも見下され、ゲームオーバーになるわ。気をつけなさい。
If you are spotted doing something suspicious, the person who spotted you is going to gossip about you and damage your reputation. \n\n You can see your current reputation at the bottom-left corner of the screen. The white bar is your current reputation. The pink number represents how your reputation is going to change the next time that students gather to gosisp. \n\n You can recover lost reputation by talking to people who witnessed you and apologizing to them. You can also improve your reputation by complimenting people or doing "Tasks" for them. \n\n If you lose too much reputation, everyone in school will look down on you - including your beloved Senpai. This will result in a game over, so take good care of your reputation.=不審な行動を見られると、悪い噂を流されて、評判が下がってしまうわ。\n評判は画面の左下で確認できるわ。白いバーが今の評価、ピンクの数字は次の噂が広がる時間帯に変わる評判を表しているわ。\n人に見られても、謝ることで評判を取り戻すことができるわ。生徒と会話したり、頼み事を聞いたりすることでも評判を上げることができるわ。\n評判が下がりすぎると、あらゆる生徒、もちろんセンパイからも見下され、ゲームオーバーになるわ。気をつけなさい。
Getting Money=お金を得る
Some actions - Like buying something from a vending machine - will require money.=自販機で何かを買うときなんかはお金が必要よ。
To earn cash, you can work a part-time job as a maid.=メイドカフェでアルバイトをしてお金を稼ぐことができるわ。
When you return home, use the door in your room to access the "Street". That's where you can work as a maid.=家に帰ったら、外に出て商店街へ向かえばメイドカフェがあるわ。
Or, you could access the "Drops" menu through my app on your phone, and trade me Info Points for soe cash...I'll leave it up to you.=もしくは、インフォちゃんのアプリの「ドロップ」から、ポイントと現金を交換してあげるわ。
Some actions - like buying something from a vending machine - will require money. \n\n To earn cash, you can work a part-time job as a maid. \n\n When you return home, use the door in your room to access the "Street". That's where you can work as a maid. \n\n Or, you could access the "Drops" menu through my app on your phone, and trade me Info Points for some cash...I'll leave it up to you.=自販機で何かを買うときなんかはお金が必要よ。\nメイドカフェでアルバイトをしてお金を稼ぐことができるわ。\n家に帰ったら、外に出て商店街へ向かえばメイドカフェがあるわ。\nもしくは、インフォちゃんのアプリの「ドロップ」から、ポイントと現金を交換してあげるわ。
If you need to do something that could get you in big trouble - like stealing something from the faculty room - it would be wise to use a distraction to make any potential witnesses leave the area. \n\n If you tap the Left CTRL key (or the RB button if you're using a gamepad), you will giggle. This will usually cause a person to stop what they're doing and investigate the mysterious sound. \n\n There is a radio in the school's Audio/Video room. If you activate it, it will play obnoxious music, and the nearest person will walk over to turn it off. You can also turn it on with a remote control. \n\n If you throw a "Bang Snap", it will make a noise, and the nearest person will investigate. You can craft a Bang Snap using the workbench in the school's room Workshop, or buy some from my Drops menu.=職員室から何かを盗むときみたいに、大問題になりそうなことをするなら、目撃者がその場を離れるように注意をそらさなきゃね。\n\n左CTRLキー(ゲームパッドならRBボタン)をタップすること、笑い声を出せるわ。そうすると、声を聞いた人は気になって見に来る。\n\n視聴覚室にはラジオがあって、起動させると騒音が流れて近くに来た人が消しに来るはずよ。リモコンでも消せるわ。\n\n爆竹を投げると音が鳴って、近くの人が見に来るわ。爆竹は図工室の作業台で作れるし、ドロップメニューで購入することもできるわ。
You can interact with a mirror to change your "Persona" - your behavior and personality!=鏡を調べると「ペルソナ」、つまり立ち振る舞いを変更できるわ！
People will respond more positively to you depending on your behavior. You can interact with a mirror to change your "Persona" - the way you behave. \n\n For example, if you would like to compliment a student who has a "Heroic" Persona, you should use a mirror to switch to the Heroic Persona before you interact with that student. \n\n Matching a student's Persona will increase the effect of your compliments, apologies, and gossip - basically enhancing any social interaction with that student. \n\n It might be possible to join the gang of delinquent boys who hang out near the incinerator by befriending them all, dying your hair blonde, and using the "Tough" Persona...=あなたの振る舞いによって相手からの印象をより良くできるわ。鏡を調べることで「ペルソナ」、つまりあなたの立ち振る舞いを変えることができるの。\n\n例えば、「勇敢」な性格の相手に話しかけるときは、活発なペルソナに変えるといいわ。\n\n相手に適したペルソナで話しかけると、おしゃべり、謝罪、噂話などの効果が上昇するわ。\n\nそれと、焼却炉周りの不良と仲間になりたいなら、全員と友達になって、髪を染めて、「強気」ペルソナにすればもしかしたら...
Tutrials Disabled=チュートリアルの中止
I look time out of my day to help you out, and this is a thanks I get? Fine. I can take a hint. I know when I'm not wanted.=こんなに手を貸そうとしているのに、これが感謝の気持ち？いいわ。もう私の助言はいらないのね。
Don't blame me if you get lost or can't figure out what to do. When that happens, remember that you brought it upon yourself.=もし目標が分からなくなっても、すべきことを見失っても、私のせいじゃないわ。あなたが招いた結果よ。
In fact, I'm gonna laugh my ass off if I see you get a game over because you lacked crucial information that my tutorial was going to give you.=私の助言を断ったせいでゲームオーバーになったなら、私は笑い転げるでしょうね。
When you're ready to come crawling back and beg for my forgiveness, you can re-enable tutorial pop-ups in the Setting Menu. =這いつくばって私の許しを請うなら、いいわよ。メニューの設定からもう一度チュートリアルを有効にしてちょうだい。
I took time out of my day to help you out, and this is the thanks I get? Fine. I can take a hint. I know when I'm not wanted. \n\n Don't blame me if you get lost or can't figure out what to do. When that happens, remember that you brought it upon yourself. \n\n In fact, I'm gonna laugh my ass off if I see you get a game over because you lacked crucial information that my tutorial was going to give you. \n\n When you're ready to come crawling back and beg for my forgiveness, you can re-enable tutorial pop-ups in the Settings Menu.=こんなに手を貸そうとしているのに、これが感謝の気持ち？いいわ。もう私の助言はいらないのね。\nもし目標が分からなくなっても、すべきことを見失っても、私のせいじゃないわ。あなたが招いた結果よ。\n私の助言を断ったせいでゲームオーバーになったなら、私は笑い転げるでしょうね。\n這いつくばって私の許しを請うなら、いいわよ。メニューの設定からもう一度チュートリアルを有効にしてちょうだい。
If you help me, I'll help you. I don't need money, though...I need favors. To make things simple, let's imagine that doing favors for me will earn you "points". We can call them..."Info Points". \n\n If you send me a photo of a student's face, I'll give you 1 Info Point. Oh, and if you send me a picture of a girl's panties, that's 5 Info points. 10 Points if they're one of the "popular girls." \n\n I need eyes and ears all over the school. I've supplied you with ten covert listening devices. Each one you place will earn you 5 Info Points. Each one belongs in a specific location. \n\n I need physical access to a phone in order to install my spying software on it. If you steal someone's phone and slip it under my door, I'll reward you with 20 Info Points. Make sure to return it to them afterwards!=あなたが私を手伝ってくれるなら、私もあなたを手伝ってあげる。お金は要らないけど...頼みごとがあるの。手伝ってくれたら、そうね...「Infoポイント」をあげるわ。\n\n生徒の顔写真を送ってくれたら1ポイントあげる。女子のパンツの写真を送ってくれたら、5ポイント。人気者の女子のパンツなら10ポイントよ。\n\nそれと、校内の情報をくまなく集めたいの。あなたに10個の盗聴器を渡したわ。1つ設置するごとに5ポイントよ。それぞれ指定の場所に設置しなさい。\n\nスマホにスパイアプリをインストールするには、現物が必要なの。誰かのスマホを盗んで、私の部屋のドアの下から入れたら、20ポイントあげる。終わったら必ずスマホは返しなさい！



月曜日 朝1 Senpaiと会話
Ugh! You can be such a pain, Senpai!=Ai! Você pode ser tão irritante, Senpai!  
I'm sorry...=Me desculpa...  
I can't believe you overslept again! It's just like back in middle school!=Eu não acredito que você dormiu demais de novo! É igual na época da escola!  
I'm not your personal alarm clock, you know! You can't rely on me to wake you up every day!=Eu não sou seu despertador, sabia?! Você não pode depender de mim para te acordar todo dia!  
I'm sorry...if it bothers you so much, maybe we should stop walking to school together.=Me desculpa...se isso te incomoda tanto, talvez devêssemos parar de ir juntos para a escola.  
...n...no...that...that's not what I...=...n-não...isso...não foi o que eu...  
...just forget it, okay?!=...só esquece, tá bom?!  
ANYway, I want you to meet me on the school rooftop at lunchtime. Got it?=DE qualquer forma, quero que você me encontre no telhado da escola na hora do almoço. Entendeu?  
Huh? Why?=Hã? Por quê?  
Stop being so difficult! Just be there, all right? And don't keep me waiting!=Para de ser tão difícil! Apenas esteja lá, tá bom? E não me faça esperar!  
Okay, okay! I'll be there.=Tá, tá! Eu vou.  
Good!=Ótimo!

会話を妨害した場合
Um, this is supposed to be a private conversation...oh, nevermind, we'll finish this another time.=Um, isso deveria ser uma conversa privada...ah, esqueça, terminamos isso outra hora.
Um...this is...a private conversation...nevermind. We'll just talk later.=Um...isso é...uma conversa privada...esqueça. Vamos conversar depois.
Um, excuse me? We're trying to have a private conversation here! (Sigh) Never mind, we'll just...talk later.=Um, com licença? Estamos tentando ter uma conversa privada aqui! (Suspiro) Esqueça, nós apenas...falamos depois.
月曜日 朝2 ライバルと会話
Um...Osana...don't you think you were a bit...harsh?=Um...Osana...não acha que você foi um pouco...dura?
I know...I feel so bad about it...but, I didn't do it on purpose! It just...happened...=Eu sei...me sinto tão mal com isso...mas eu não fiz de propósito! Apenas...aconteceu...
Every time I think he's about to realize how I feel about him, I get afraid he'll reject me...=Toda vez que eu penso que ele está prestes a perceber como eu me sinto em relação a ele, tenho medo de que ele me rejeite...
It makes me feel so scared...I start saying stuff to make him think I don't like him!=Isso me faz sentir tão assustada...começo a dizer coisas para fazê-lo pensar que eu não gosto dele!
Why do I have to be this way...? Why can't I just be honest with him...=Por que eu tenho que ser assim...? Por que não consigo ser honesta com ele...
Don't beat yourself up over it, Osana. It'll be okay! Everything is going to work out fine.=Não se culpe tanto por isso, Osana. Vai ficar tudo bem! Tudo vai dar certo.
I sure hope so...=Eu realmente espero que sim...

朝1のイベントを妨害した場合
Um...Osana...what exactly happened back there?=Um...Osana...o que exatamente aconteceu lá?
Ugh...I don't want to talk about it. Come on, let's just go.=Ugh...não quero falar sobre isso. Vamos, vamos apenas ir.

Raibaruがいじめにあっている場合
Hey...Osana...um...I've been thinking...and...it would probably be for the best...if...=Ei...Osana...hum...estive pensando...e...provavelmente seria melhor...se...
Don't. I know what this is about. It's those stupid rumors, right? I don't care what people are saying. You're my friend. I'm not going to abandon you.=Não. Eu sei sobre o que é isso. São aqueles rumores estúpidos, certo? Eu não me importo com o que as pessoas estão dizendo. Você é minha amiga. Não vou te abandonar.
You don't understand...if you spend time around me, you'll become a target, too. I don't want you to get dragged into my mess.=Você não entende...se passar tempo comigo, você também se tornará um alvo. Eu não quero que você se envolva na minha bagunça.
I already told you: I don't care! I won't desert a friend just because of some pretty drama!=Já te disse: não me importo! Não vou abandonar uma amiga só por causa de um drama qualquer!
I already told you: I don't care! I won't desert a friend just because of some petty drama!=Já te disse: não me importo! Não vou abandonar uma amiga só por causa de um drama qualquer!
Osana...it's not your choice to make. I've already made my decision. Please...just let me alone.=Osana...não é você quem deve decidir. Já tomei minha decisão. Por favor...me deixe em paz.
Osana...it's not your choice to make. I've already made my decision. Please...just let me be alone.=Osana...não é você quem deve decidir. Já tomei minha decisão. Por favor...me deixe em paz.
Raibaru, I...(sigh)...I can't talk you out of this, can I? ...well...if you change your mind, let me know. I'll be at your side in a heartbeat.=Raibaru, eu...(suspiro)...não posso te convencer do contrário, posso? ...bem...se você mudar de ideia, me avise. Estarei ao seu lado imediatamente.

月曜日 朝4 好きな人についての会話withライバル

So...what IS your type, then? You mentioned that you like guys with tans, but...what else do you like to see in a guy?=Então...qual é o seu tipo, então? Você mencionou que gosta de caras bronzeados, mas...o que mais você gosta em um cara?
Well...I think it's kinda hot when a guy has a ponytail. I think boys with glasses are super cute. And if a guy has piercings...ahh...I just melt!=Bem...eu acho meio sexy quando um cara tem um rabo de cavalo. Acho que garotos de óculos são super fofos. Aparência não é tudo! Por exemplo: eu não consigo me dar bem com alguém se for burro como uma pedra. Então, na verdade, a coisa mais importante é a inteligência!
Oh! And, he has to love cats! If he's a dog person...we're completely incompatible.=Ah! E ele tem que amar gatos! Se ele for um amante de cachorros...nós somos completamente incompatíveis.

月曜日 朝6ライバルと会話からの部活周り

木曜日 朝1 登校中の会話
Osana-chan=Osana-chan
Senpai-kun=Senpai-kun

I guess I wouldn't really call it a nightmare...just a weird dream. How about you?=Pesadelos? Bem...últimamente, eu tenho tido um sonho em que estou de pé fora da escola, embaixo de uma árvore...e, por algum motivo, não consigo mover um único músculo...Estou como uma estátua. Eu acho que não chamaria exatamente isso de pesadelo...apenas um sonho estranho. E você?
Sometimes, I have dreams where...somebody ties my hair around something really heavy, and...throws it into the ocean. I get dragged into the water and...drown...=Às vezes, eu tenho sonhos em que...alguém amarra meu cabelo em algo muito pesado e...joga no oceano. Eu sou puxada para a água e...me afogo...
That sounds pretty scary! ...You know, I read a book that said our dreams are actually reflections of our subconscious feelings. Maybe your dream means that you subconsciously feel worried that your hair is a hazard. If you cut your hair...maybe...you'd stop having the nightmares.=Isso soa bem assustador! ...Sabe, eu li um livro que dizia que nossos sonhos são na verdade reflexos dos nossos sentimentos subconscientes. Talvez seu sonho signifique que você subconscientemente se preocupa que seu cabelo seja um perigo. Se você cortar o cabelo...talvez...você pararia de ter esses pesadelos.
No way! It took years for my hair to get this long; I wouldn't cut it because of a scary dream...=Nem pensar! Levou anos para o meu cabelo crescer tanto; eu não vou cortar por causa de um sonho assustador...
When do you plan to cut your hair, anyway? It's almost touching the ground...=Quando você planeja cortar seu cabelo, afinal? Está quase tocando o chão...
I made a promise to myself not to cut it until...a certain idiot stops being stupid and realizes how I feel...=Eu fiz uma promessa para mim mesma de não cortar até...um certo idiota parar de ser estúpido e perceber como eu me sinto...
Huh? I don't get what you mean...=Hã? Não entendi o que você quer dizer...
A-anyway, if our dreams really do have meaning...what does your dream represent?=A-a, se nossos sonhos realmente têm um significado...o que o seu sonho representa?
I...haven't really figured that out yet...=Eu...ainda não descobri isso...

火曜日 朝1 Senpaiと会話
Hey, Senpai! How many dishes do you know how to cook?=ねえ、センパイ！センパイってどれくらいの料理の作り方を知ってるの？
Oh, gosh...well, it's embarassing to admit this, but I actually don't know how to cook anything at all.=えっと...恥ずかしながら、実は料理を全然やったことないんだよね。
Would you be willing to let me teach you how to cook a simple dish? It'll be so much fun, I promise!=簡単な料理から教わる気はない？絶対楽しいわよ！
Uh - right now, at school? No, I'm sure I would screw up and make a mess and get my uniform all dirty...=うーん、今すぐ、学校で？きっと失敗して制服を汚しちゃうよ...
Hehe, that's what an apron is for, silly! It doesn't matter if you make a mess - your clothes will be fine!=エプロンがあれば大丈夫よ！汚しても制服は無事だから！
Me, wearing an apron? I just...can't see it. I feel like it just wouldn't be...me.=僕にエプロン？どうかな...似合わなくない？

My favorite color? That's an easy one - it's black! The coolest color!=好きな色？もちろん黒さ！一番クールだし！
Then, I'll sew you a stylish black apron so that you can feel cool while you're learning how to cook! I'll give it to you at lunchtime!=じゃあ、料理をしながらクールな気持ちになれるよう、黒でスタイリッシュなエプロンを縫ってあげるね！お昼に渡すわ！
...r...really? You don't have to go that far...but...now I'm curious what it'll look like. Okay, then...I'll look forward to lunchtime!=ほ、本当？そこまでしてくれるなんて...でもどんなものか気になるなあ。それじゃあ...お昼を楽しみにしてるよ！

火曜日 昼1a 妨害しなかった場合

I'm so happy that you like it!=気に入ってくれて嬉しいわ！
I don't know why I thought that all aprons had to be pink and girly. You really proved me wrong!=なんでかエプロンってものはピンクで女の子っぽいものだと思ってたよ。こんなエプロンもあるんだね！
So, does this make you feel interested in learning how to cook?=これで料理のお勉強に興味出てきたでしょ？
Honestly...yeah, it does! I can't wait until I have a good opportunity to wear this apron for the first time!=ああ、そうだね！このエプロンを着るときが楽しみで仕方ないよ！
Oh, that's wonderful! How about tomorrow? I'll reccomend a good dish for a beginner!=よかった！明日はどう？初心者向けの料理を教えてあげる！
Oh, that's wonderful! How about tomorrow? I'll recommend a good dish for a beginner!=よかった！明日はどう？初心者向けの料理を教えてあげる！
I would appreciate that a lot! I'm looking forward to it!=本当にありがとう！楽しみにしてるよ！

火曜日 昼1b 妨害した場合
...uh...Amai...is this your idea of a joke?=...えっと...Amai...面白いと思ってるの？
No. No, wait. Senpai...that's not the apron I made for you...=えっ、違うわ、待って、センパイ...これは私が作ったエプロンじゃないわ...
What do you mean? Where's the right apron, then?=どういうこと？じゃあ本物のエプロンはどこにあるのさ？
...I...I don't know. I...can't imagine how the apron I made could have swapped places with another one...=...わからないわ。私が作ったエプロンがどう他のエプロンと入れ替わったかなんて、想像できない。
...yeah, I, uh...I don't really know what to say...=...そう...あの...言ってる意味がわからないんだけど...
Senpai, I promise I'll find the right apron and get it to you, okay? Please just...forget that this mix-up ever happened.=センパイ、本物のエプロンを見つけて渡すから、ね？だから...このことは忘れて。
...I, uh...yeah. Sure. Okay. I guess.=...うーん...まあ...考えておくよ...

水曜日 朝1 Senpaiと会話
Good morning, Senpai! Ready to learn how to cook?=おはよう、センパイ！料理を習う準備はできた？
I'm still pretty nervous...I feel like I'm going to screw it up.=まだ結構緊張してるよ...失敗するんじゃないかな...
Don't worry, Senpai! Cooking is easy! All you have to do is follow the recipe!=大丈夫よ、センパイ！料理は簡単なの！レシピに従うだけでいいんだから！
If that's really all there is to it, then...I suppose I shouldn't be so worried.=それだけでいいなら...確かに心配し過ぎかも...
Here - I picked out a dish that even a beginner should be able to prepare, and wrote down the recipe for you.=ほら、初心者でも作りやすい料理をピックアップして、レシピを書いておいたわ。
...hmm...okay...looks...simple enough...=...ふむふむ...へえ...簡単そうだね...
I'll be pretty busy today, so I won't be available to help you out...but, trust me - you won't need any help!=私は今日忙しいから協力できないの。でも一人で作れるぐらい簡単だから大丈夫よ！
All right, if you say so!=わかった、キミがそう言うなら！
Let's meet up at lunchtime so that you can tell me how it turned out!=お昼になったらどうだったか教えてね！
Okay, then - see you at lunchtime!=わかったよ。それじゃ、またお昼に！

水曜日 昼1a 妨害しなかった場合
Hey, Senpai! How did the dish turn out?=ねえ、センパイ！料理はどうだった？
Actually, it turned out great!=大成功だったよ！
Oh, I'm so happy to hear that!=わあ、うまく行ったようで嬉しいわ！
Following the instructions was easier than I expected, and the dish tasted delicious!=レシピに従うのは思ったより簡単だったし、完成した料理も美味しかったよ！
That's wonderful news!=でしょでしょ？
And, thanks to that apron you gave me, my uniform didn't get dirty, either!=それにキミが作ってくれたエプロンのおかげで、制服も汚れなかったよ！
See, Senpai? I told you that there was nothing to worry about!=ね、センパイ！心配する必要なんてなかったでしょ？
Would you be willing to share more recipes with me?=ああ、他のレシピも教えてくれないかな？
Absolutely! I'll turn you into a five-star chef, Senpai!=もちろん！私があなたを5つ星のシェフにしてあげるわ、センパイ！
Haha! I wouldn't go that far, but cooking sure is fun!=ハハハ！それは無理だよ！でも、料理って本当に楽しいね！

水曜日 昼1b 妨害した場合
...uh...well...not so good...=...うーん...うまく行かなかったよ...
...oh...I'm really sorry to hear that...what happened?=...そう...残念だわ...何があったの？
Well, I followed the recipe to the letter, but the end result was...a disaster.=えっと、レシピ通りに作ったんだけど...なんというか...地獄だったよ。
Really? That doesn't make any sense. Do you still have the recipe with you?=え？なんでかしら。そのレシピを見せてくれる？
Yeah, I do. Here it is.=ああ、これだよ。
Let me just take a look at it for a moment, and...wait. What?! Senpai...this recipe is all wrong!=ちょっとだけ見せて...まって、何これ！？センパイ...このレシピ全部間違ってるわ！
Huh? What do you mean?=え？どういうこと？
These are not the correct ingredients or instructions! This...this isn't what I wrote down for you!=材料も調理方法も全部間違えてる！これ...私が書いたレシピじゃないわ！
...well...I don't know what to tell you. I guess I'll let you figure out this mystery on your own...=...えっと...なんというか...それじゃあこの謎はキミ自身で解決してね...

木曜日 朝1 登校中の会話
So, Senpai, are you still open to the idea of letting me teach you how to cook?=センパイ、私に料理を教わるって話、どうなったかしら？
Well, sort of. But...there are a few things that make cooking seem kinda...scary. Sharp knives...open flames...boiling water...if I make a single mistake, I could get hurt!=えっと、教わりたいよ。でも、料理ってやっぱり少しだけ...怖いんだ。鋭いナイフや...火...煮だったお湯...ちょっと失敗しただけで、怪我しそうだろ？
Haha, it's really not that scary at all! Each one of those problems has a solution, you know. For example, if you're worried about open flames, you could use an induction cooktop! Those can't burn you!=ハハハ、そんなに怖がらなくていいのよ！どれも対策方法があるの。例えば、火が怖いならIHコンロを使えばいいのよ。そしたら燃えたりしないでしょ？
Oh...I never knew that! Is there any reason why someone would actually want to use a gas stove instead of an induction cooktop, then?=へえ...知らなかったな。それだとIHコンロの代わりにガスコンロを使いたい理由なんてあるかな？
Yeah, there are plenty of reasons! For example, some cooking techniques require quick changes in temperature, and that's only possible with a gas stove. I use gas stoves exclusively!=うん、理由は沢山あるわよ！例えば、調理によって温度をすぐに変えなきゃダメなこともあって、それはガスコンロにしかできないのよ。だから私はほとんどガスコンロを使うわね！
Really? Aren't you worried about a gas leak causing an explosion, or anything like that?=本当に？ガス漏れで爆発する心配とかはないの？
Not at all! Gas stoves have safety features to prevent that sort of thing from happening. For example, there's a sensor that stops the release of gas if there isn't any flame burning.=全然！ガスコンロには安全装置がついてるからね。例えば、火がついていないときはガスを止めてくれるセンサーがあるの
Besides that, there's an air vent over the stove to let gas escape. As long as that air vent is functioning, there's no way that enough gas could build up to cause an explosion.=それに、コンロの上にはガスを逃がすための通気口もあるのよ。その通気口にイタズラでもされていなければ、爆発する程のガスが溜まることはないんだ。
But, most importantly...before I start using a stove, I *always* check for the smell of gas. I would never ignite a stove if I could smell an obvious gas leak! I would shut it off right away!=でも、一番大事なことはね...火を使う前にガスの臭いがしないか必ず確認すること！私はガス漏れの臭いがしたときは、絶対に点火しない！すぐに辞めるわ！
Wow! You really seem to know your stuff, Amai! But...you specialize in baked goods, and chocolates, and stuff like that, right? How often do you actually need to cook on a stovetop?=へえ、Amaiすごく詳しいんだね！でも、焼き菓子とかチョコレートとか、そういうの専門だよね。実際にコンロで料理する機会ってどれくらいなんだい？
More often than you'd think! For example, certain fudge recipes involve boiling water. In fact, I'm going to be cooking some fudge after Cleaning Time today!=よく使うわよ！例えばね、ファッジのレシピにお湯を沸かすものがあるの。実は今日、掃除の後にファッジを作ろうと思ってるんだ！
Really?! Wow! I love fudge! I'd love to taste some after you're done!=本当！？ファッジは大好物なんだ！出来上がったら、ぜひ味見させてくれよ！

木曜日 朝2 Senpaiと会話
Senpai! Have you ever been on a picnic?=センパイ！ピクニックに行ったことある？
A...picnic? You mean, eating outdoors?=ピクニック？屋外で食事するってこと？
Not just that - the full picnic experience! Bringing a basket, sitting on a blanket, admiring nature...=ピクニックはそれだけじゃないの！籠を持ってきて、ブランケットを敷いて、自然を堪能して...
Oh! Well, um...I honestly never gave it a try.=そうなんだ！うーん...やったことないなあ。
Then, let's have a picnic today at lunchtime! We'll eat next to the rose bush nearby the school gym!=それじゃあ、お昼にピクニックを体験してみましょ！体育館近くのバラ園前で食べましょう！
It sounds nice in theory, but...will we have to worry about insects? Ants and flies and that sort of thing?=いいね、でも...虫は大丈夫なの？アリやハエみたいなのが寄ってこない？
Oh, don't worry about that! There's nothing in that area that attracts bugs, so we should be fine!=大丈夫よ！あそこには虫が集まるようなものがないし、心配しなくていいわ！
Well...if you say so! Sure...let's have a picnic!=じゃあ大丈夫だね！ピクニックに行こうか！
Oh, I'm so excited! I can't wait for lunchtime!=楽しみね！昼をまちきれないわ！
Yeah...I'm looking forward to it, too!=うん...僕も楽しみだよ！

木曜日 昼1a 妨害しなかった場合
What do you think of the scenery here, Senpai? Isn't it lovely?=センパイ、この景色をどう思う？ステキでしょ？
I've never actually been back here before...it's pretty nice!=ここに来るのは初めてだけど...とってもいい場所だね！
The best part is that we're far away from everyone else, so there isn't any noise!=しかも人がいないところだから、とっても静かなの！
You're right! It's nice and quiet. I could read a book without distractions here!=そうだね！ステキな上に静かだ。ここなら本に集中できそう！
Now that we're all settled in, let's eat!=さて、落ち着いてきたし、食事にしましょ！
Yeah, let's get started! What did you bring, Amai?=ああ、そうだね！Amai、今日は何を持ってきてくれたの？
I brought some pastries from my family's bakery! And how about you?=実家のパン屋からお菓子を持ってきたの！あなたは？
Oh, I just brought some sandwiches...I'm still not much of a cook yet.=あー、サンドイッチを持ってきたよ...まだ料理には慣れてなくてね。
Don't worry, Senpai! You'll get there one day!=大丈夫よ、センパイ！すぐに上手くなるわ！
Haha...we'll see about that!=ハハハ...それはまた今度かな！

木曜日 昼1b 妨害した場合
...wait a minute...something's wrong...=...待って...いつもはこんな...
Uh, Amai...I thought you said we wouldn't have to worry about insects.=えっと、Amai...虫の心配はしなくていいって言ってたよね？
I don't understand! There's no good reason for a bunch of ants and flies to be here!=なんで！？アリやハエが集まるようなものはないはずよ！
Maybe an animal died back here? And the decaying corpse attracted a bunch of -=動物が裏で亡くなったとか？裏で死体が腐って虫が...
Ugh - don't talk about dead animals and rotting flesh! I'm going to lose my appetite!=ちょっと！動物の死体や腐った肉の話はやめて！食欲がなくなっちゃう！
...I hate to say it, but I think my appetite is already gone.=...言いたくはないけど、僕はもう食欲なくなってるんだよね。
...oh, no...these stupid bugs ruined everything...=...そんな...この虫たちのせいで台無しよ...
I'm sorry, Amai. Maybe we should eat indoors today, after all.=ごめんね、Amai。今日は屋内で食べようよ。
...this...this was...this was supposed to be fun...=...そんな...楽しいピクニックになるはずだったのに...
...(sigh)...sheesh...what a shame...=...はあ...残念だったね...

木曜日 放課後a お菓子作り(妨害しなかった場合)

...and...=...それから...

木曜日 放課後b お菓子作り(妨害した場合)
...ugh, that smell! no, it can't be...a gas leak?!=...うわっ、臭い！これって...ガス漏れ！？
I need to shut off the gas before anything can -=急いでガス栓を閉めないと...

金曜日 朝1 Senpaiと会話
Hey, Senpai! You're aware that food can be art, right?=ねえ、センパイ！料理が芸術みたいだと思ったことはない？
Art? Um...what do you mean?=芸術？どういう意味かな？
Whenever I finish baking a cake, I make a sculpture on top using the icing!=私はケーキを焼いたあと、上の方に氷の像を作ってるの。
Really? Wow! That sounds cool!=本当？わあ、すごくクールだね！
Yeah! I have a Saikougram account where I post all of my cake art!=ええ！サイコウグラムにケーキアートをアップしてるの！
Oh, awesome! Do you get a lot of views?=へえ、すごいや！たくさんの人に見てもらえるんでしょ？
Well, I don't mean to brag, but...recently, I reached ten thousand followers!=実はね、自慢じゃないんだけど...最近フォロワーが1万人を超えたの！
Whoa! I didn't realize you were Internet famous! Send me a link so I can check out your work!=うわあ！有名人じゃん！あとでリンク送ってよ！キミのアートを見たいな！
Okay - but first, I need to go put the finishing touches on my latest masterpiece in the Home Ec room!=わかったわ。でも先に家庭科室で最新作の仕上げをしないと！
I'm worried about my next exam, so I'm going to spend the morning studying. I'll check out your page at lunchtime, though!=僕は次の試験が心配だし、午前中は勉強することにするよ。昼にチェックするね！

金曜日 放課後1 告白
...A...Amai?=ア、Amai？
...I'm...s-sorry to trouble you, Senpai...=急に呼び出してごめんなさい、センパイ...
...I asked you to come here because...there's something...I want to say...=ここに来てもらったのは、伝えたいことがあって...
What is it?=なんだい？
...over the past few years...I've been so busy helping my mom and dad with their bakery...=ここ数年は...両親のパン屋を手伝うのに忙しくて...
...I never had any time for...dating, or...anything like that...=私にはデートとか...そんな時間はなかったんだ...
...I even started to worry that I'd go my entire life without ever experiencing romance...=そういう経験もない一生になるのかなって...不安だった...
...but...recently...I've been developing feelings for someone...=でも最近...ある人のことが気になってて...
Who?=誰？
...haha...you still haven't figured it out yet...?...=はは...まだ気づいてないの？
...you know...when I first met you, at that bus stop...=...あのね...初めてあなたに会った時、あのバス停で...
...you actually made me feel really upset! ...do you want to know why...?...=...あなたは本当に私を驚かせたの！...どうしてか知りたい？
...you were sad because of a girl...which means that you really cared about her a lot...=...ある女の子のために悲しんでいた...つまり、その子のことを本当に大切に思っていた...
...I've always wanted someone to care about me in the same way that you cared about her...=...私はいつも、あなたが彼女を気にかけていたように、私を気にかけてくれる誰かを探してた...
...so...I started...trying to make my way into your heart...=...だから...私は...あなたの心に入ろうとしたんだ...
...I want you to care about me, because...=...私のことを、気にかけてほしかったの...だから...
...I've fallen deeply in love with you, Senpai!=...あなたのこと好きになっちゃったの！センパイ！

金曜日 放課後2a 告白成功
To tell you the truth...=実を言うと...
I...I feel the same way about you!=ぼ...僕も同じ気持ちだよ！
...hey...you mean it, right...?...you're not just...you're not just saying that, right...?=...ねえ...本当に？...う、嘘じゃないよね...？
You're telling the truth, right?!=あなたも、同じ気持ちなの！？
Of course I am. I love you!=そうだよ、僕もキミのことが好きなんだ！
...I...I...oh...I've never been...so happy...=...わ...私...人生で一番幸せ...
...oh, Senpai...please...let's stay together...forever...=...ねえ...センパイ...一生...一緒だからね...

金曜日 放課後2b 告白失敗

...I'm very sorry, but...I don't think we're right for each other...=...申し訳ないけれど、僕らは合わないと思うんだ。
...n...no...=...そ...そんな...
...is this...because of all the things that went wrong this week...?=今週...何もかもうまく行かなかったから...？
...no...it's not just that...=いや、そうじゃなくて...
...it's...it's more than that.=それ以上と言うか...
...Senpai, I...I know I screwed up, but...=...センパイ、私...失敗しちゃったのは分かってる。でも...
...if...if you give me another chance, I can...=...もう一度チャンスをくれれば、今度は...
Please...don't.=もう...やめて。
It's just...not going to work.=それじゃ、うまくいくわけがないよ。
I'm sorry.=ごめん...
Goodbye...=さようなら...
...S...Senpai...no...please...wait...=センパイ...待って...お願い...

親からの電話　括弧付きのテキストは母親のセリフですが現状だと字幕はないので訳さなくてもいいかも？
Mom's calling me? I hope it's nothing serious...=ママから？どうしたんだろう...
Hi, mom! Is everything okay?=もしもしママ？どうかした？
(No! We're having an emergency at the bakery!)
Whoa, slow down! What's wrong?=うわ、落ち着いてよ！どうしたのよ？
(There are rats in the kitchen!)
...rats?! Are you serious?!=ネズミ！？ウソでしょ！？
(Yes! There are dozens of them!)
...wait...what...?...how is that...even possible...?=え？待ってよ...そんなことあり得る？
(Do you have any idea how this could have happened?)
...well, I...I have a theory...=うん...ちょっと心当たりが...
(What? What is it?)
A lot of bad things have been happening to us recently. It doesn't feel...natural. It feels like...someone is...doing this to us.=最近、嫌なことばかり起こるよね、不自然だよ。まるで、誰かに仕込まれているような。
(Huh? What do you mean?)
You know that new bakery that opened up in town recently? I think...I think they're trying to -=街に新しいパン屋ができたの知ってる？多分、多分あの人たちが...
(Stop right there. Before you say anything about them...do you have any evidene to back up your theory?)
...(sigh)...no...I don't...=...ハア...いや...何も...
(You shouldn't accuse anyone of wrongdoing without any evidence.)
...yeah...you're right...=...うん...そうだね...
(Aside from that, can you think of any other way that the rats could have gotten into our bakery?)
...no...not a clue...=ううん、わかんない...
(Alright. That's all I wanted to ask. I'll let you go.)
...okay...good luck...=うん...がんばってね...
(Mom hangs up.)
...(sigh)...I know I'm right, but...how do I prove it...?...=はあ...私はきっと間違ってない...でも証拠はないしな...









コピペ元出力
告白(多分共通)
(Your rival confesses her feelings to Senpai...)=ライバルは自分の思いをセンパイに伝えた...
Senpai accepts your rival's confession...=センパイはそれを受け入れた...
(Senpai rejects your rival's confession!)=センパイはそれを拒否した！

Kaguya
月1
Hey, Senpai! Got a second?=ねえセンパイ！ちょっといい？
Yeah, what's up?=もちろん。どうしたの？
I made a bento for my sister this morning, but she left the house without it.=今朝妹のお弁当を作ったんだけど、あの子お弁当を忘れてっちゃったの。
I don't want it to go to waste! Would you like to have it?=もったいないし、よかったら食べてくれない？
Oh, sure! I'd be happy to!=もちろんいいよ！
Great! Here it is! I hope you enjoy it!=やったぁ！はいこれ。お口に合うといいな！
Thanks! I'll keep it on my desk for now, and eat it at lunchtime.=ありがとう。とりあえず机の上に置いといて、昼に食べることにするよ。
Okay! At 5:15 PM, let's meet up back here, so you can tell me how it tasted!=わかった。5:15にここで待ち合わせして、感想を教えてね！
Alright, sounds like a plan!=OK。良い考えだね。
Yay! I'm looking forward to it!=イエーイ！楽しみにしてるね！

月2a
Hey, Senpai! Did you like the bento?=センパイ！お弁当は気に入ってくれた？
Yeah, I loved it! It was delicious!=うん、とても美味しかったよ！
Oh?! Really?! You did?!=本当！？美味しかった？
Yep! You're a great cook!=うん！君は料理上手だね！
Oh, it makes me so happy to hear that!=そう言ってもらえると嬉しい！
I can't promise that I'll always be able to bring an extra bento to school...=いつも学校にお弁当を持ってくるのは無理だけど...
...but, it makes me really glad to know that you like my cooking!=私の料理を気に入ってくれてとても嬉しい！
Would you, um...like to walk home together...?...=あの、その...一緒に帰らない？
Sure, I'd be happy to!=いいよ、喜んで！

月2b(一文目はaと同じにつき省略)

金2a

sr:"^(?<hairstyle>Your rival (?:might like|likes) her suitor[^\n]+)\n\n(?<accessory>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes) [^\n]+|The suitor lacks [^\n]+)\n\n(?<facialware>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes) [^\n]+|The suitor lacks [^\n]+)\n\n(?<skin>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes) [^\n]+|The suitor lacks [^\n]+)\n\n(?<haircolor>Your rival (?:doesn't (?:seem to|like)|likes) [^\n]+)\n\n(?<jewelry>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes|is disappointed) [^\n]+)\n\n(?<panties>Consider visiting the lingerie store [^\n]+|The panties you put on [^\n]+)\n\n(?<manga>You can provide the suitor [^\n]+|The romance manga [^\n]+)\n\n(?<psychology>You could provide the suitor [^\n]+|Your knowledge of psychology [^\n]+)$"=${hairstyle}\n\n${accessory}\n\n${facialware}\n\n${skin}\n\n${haircolor}\n\n${jewelry}\n\n${panties}\n\n${manga}\n\n${psychology}

Your rival likes her suitor's hairstyle!=Sua rival gostou do estilo de cabelo do pretendente!
The suitor lacks accessories that your rival finds appealing.=O pretendente precisa de acessórios que sua rival ache atraentes.
Your rival likes her suitor's piercings!=Os piercings do pretendente são do gosto da sua rival!
The suitor lacks facialwear that your rival finds appealing.=O pretendente precisa de acessórios para o rosto que sua rival ache atraentes.
Your rival likes her suitor's glasses!=Os óculos do pretendente são do gosto da sua rival!
Your rival doesn't seem to have a preference regarding skin color.=Sua rival não parece ter preferência quanto à cor da pele.
Your rival likes her suitor's tan!=Sua rival gosta da pele bronzeada do pretendente!
The suitor lacks a physical trait that your rival is attracted to.=O pretendente precisa mudar uma característica física que atrai sua rival.
Your rival doesn't seem to have a preference regarding hair color.=Sua rival não parece ter preferência quanto à cor do cabelo.
Your rival likes her suitor's hair color!=Sua rival gosta da cor do cabelo do pretendente!
Your rival doesn't like her suitor's hair color.=Sua rival não gosta da cor do cabelo do pretendente.
Your rival doesn't seem to care whether or not someone is wearing jewelry.=Sua rival não parece se importar se alguém está usando joias ou não.
Your rival likes her suitor's jewelry!=As joias do pretendente são do gosto da sua rival!
Your rival is disappointed that her suitor doesn't wear jewelry.=Sua rival está decepcionada por o pretendente não usar joias.
Consider visiting the lingerie store in town to purchase panties that boost your matchmaking skill.=Considere visitar a loja de lingerie na cidade para comprar calcinhas que aumentam sua habilidade de combinar pares.
The panties you put on this morning put you into the right mindset to give your suitor the best advice!=As calcinhas que você usou esta manhã te colocaram na mentalidade certa para dar o melhor conselho ao pretendente!
You can provide the suitor with better advice if you visit the manga store in town, purchase romance manga, and read it at night.=Você pode dar um melhor conselho ao pretendente se visitar a loja de mangás na cidade, comprar mangás de romance e lê-los à noite.
The romance manga you've been reading contained helpful advice for your suitor!=O mangá de romance que você tem lido continha conselhos úteis para o pretendente!
You could provide the suitor with better advice if you studied psychology at classtime.=Você pode dar um melhor conselho ao pretendente se estudar psicologia nas aulas.
Your knowledge of psychology improved the effectiveness of your advice!=Seu conhecimento de psicologia melhorou a eficácia do seu conselho!


sr:"^(?<topics1>Your rival (?:disliked what|enjoyed what|was bored when) her suitor [^\n]+)\n\n(?<topics2>Your rival (?:disliked what|enjoyed what|was bored when) her suitor [^\n]+)\n\n(?<compliment>Your rival (?:enjoyed hearing|did not appreciate hearing|was bored when) [^\n]+)\n\n(?<gift>You did not provide [^\n]+|Your rival appreciated [^\n]+)\n\n(?<showoff>The suitor didn't have [^\n]+|Your rival (?:didn't really care|was impressed) [^\n]+)\n\nYour rival's affection for the suitor increased by (?<gained_i>\d+) points\.\n\n(?<moretogo>\d+ more points are required [^\n]+|Your rival is now in love [^\n]+)$"=${topics1}\n\n${topics2}\n\n${compliment}\n\n${gift}\n\n${showoff}\n\nA afeição da sua rival pelo pretendente aumentou em ${gained_i} pontos.\n\n${moretogo}
sr:"^Your rival disliked what her suitor said about (?<topics>[A-Z][\w\s]+)\.$"=Sua rival não gostou do que o pretendente disse sobre ${topics}.
sr:"^Your rival enjoyed what her suitor said about (?<topics>[A-Z][\w\s]+)\.$"=Sua rival gostou do que o pretendente disse sobre ${topics}.
sr:"^Your rival was bored when her suitor tried to discuss (?<topics>[A-Z][\w\s]+), because they already discussed it on a previous day\.$"=Sua rival ficou entediada quando o pretendente tentou discutir ${topics}, pois eles já conversaram sobre isso em um dia anterior.
sr:"^Your rival enjoyed hearing (?<compliment>\x22[^\x22!]+!\x22)$"=Sua rival gostou de ouvir ${compliment}.
sr:"^Your rival did not appreciate hearing (?<compliment>\x22[^\x22!]+!\x22)$"=Sua rival não gostou de ouvir ${compliment}.
You did not provide the suitor with a gift to give to your rival.=Você não forneceu um presente para o pretendente dar à sua rival.
sr:"^Your rival appreciated receiving a (?<gift>[A-Z][\w\s]+)\.$"=Sua rival gostou de receber ${gift}.
sr:"^The suitor didn't have enough (?<stat>[A-Z][a-z]+) to impress your rival\.$"=O pretendente não tinha o suficiente de ${stat} para impressionar sua rival.
sr:"^Your rival didn't really care when her suitor tried to show off his (?<stat>[A-Z][a-z]+)\.$"=Sua rival não se importou quando o pretendente tentou exibir seu ${stat}.
sr:"^Your rival was impressed with the suitor's (?<stat>[A-Z][a-z]+)\.$"=Sua rival ficou impressionada com o ${stat} do pretendente.

r:"^(?<more>\d+) more points are required in order to make your rival fall in love with her suitor\.$"=São necessários mais ${more} pontos para que sua rival se apaixone pelo pretendente.
Your rival is now in love with her suitor! She will confess to him at 5:00 PM on Friday!=Sua rival agora está apaixonada pelo pretendente! Ela confessará seus sentimentos a ele às 17:00 na sexta-feira!

sr:"^Your rival was bored when her suitor said (?<compliment>\x22[^\x22!]+!\x22), because the suitor already said that on a previous day\.$"=Sua rival ficou entediada quando o pretendente disse ${compliment}, pois ele já tinha dito isso em um dia anterior.

This task has not been discovered yet.=Esta tarefa ainda não foi descoberta.
I'm sorry...I don't think there is anything you can help me with.=Desculpe... Não acho que há algo com que você possa me ajudar.

This task is about...=Esta tarefa é sobre...

Will you accept this task?=Você aceitará esta tarefa?

(PLACEHOLDER TASK - WILL BE REPLACED IN FUTURE)\nHow am I supposed to write a report about this guy if there's only, like, one paragraph about him on Hayapedia?!=（TAREFA DE ESPAÇO RESERVADO - SERÁ SUBSTITUÍDA NO FUTURO）Como eu vou escrever um relatório sobre esse cara se há apenas, tipo, um parágrafo sobre ele na Hayapedia?

I'm so thirsty...I'm, like, dying of thirst over here...=Estou com tanta sede... estou morrendo de sede aqui...
...what? Water? No way! Water is just so plain and simple and BORING! If I'm going to drink something, I want it to be delicious, you know?!=...o que? Água? Nem pensar! Água é tão simples e sem graça e CHATA! Se eu for beber algo, quero que seja delicioso, sabe?

Vá comprar uma bebida para ele em uma máquina de vendas automática. As máquinas de vendas automáticas podem ser encontradas na cafeteria do 2º andar ou na cafeteria externa.
This student is thirsty. Go purchase a drink for them from a vending machine. Vending machines can be found on the 2nd floor cafeteria or the outdoor cafeteria.=Este estudante está com sede. Vá comprar uma bebida para ele em uma máquina de vendas automática. As máquinas de vendas automáticas podem ser encontradas na cafeteria do 2º andar ou na cafeteria externa.
Aw, man...why didn't I think of bringing any money to school with me today...=Ah, cara...por que eu não pensei em trazer dinheiro para a escola hoje...

A drink! For me?! Really?! You've saved my life! I'll never forget this!=Uma bebida! Para mim?! Sério?! Você salvou minha vida! Eu nunca vou esquecer disso!

Hey, you know those collectible wooden toys that were super popular a few years ago? My little sister got super attached to hers, but she accidentally broke part of it.=Ei, você conhece aqueles brinquedos de madeira colecionáveis que eram super populares há alguns anos? Minha irmãzinha ficou super apega ao dela, mas ela quebrou um pedaço acidentalmente.
She's been really depressed about it. I offered to buy her a new one, but she doesn't want a replacement - she wants the old one to be fixed.=Ela está muito deprimida com isso. Eu ofereci comprar um novo para ela, mas ela não quer uma substituição - ela quer que o antigo seja consertado.
I brought it to school because I thought that I might be able to repair it in the school workshop, but...honestly, I have no idea how to fix it.=Eu trouxe para a escola porque pensei que talvez eu pudesse consertá-lo na oficina da escola, mas...honestamente, não tenho ideia de como consertar.
This student wants to fix their young sibling's broken toy. Go to the Workshop on the 2nd floor and repair the broken toy.=Este estudante quer consertar o brinquedo quebrado do irmãozinho. Vá para a Oficina no 2º andar e repare o brinquedo quebrado.
Do you think if I bought her a new one, she would even be able to tell the difference...?=Você acha que se eu comprasse um novo para ela, ela conseguiria perceber a diferença...?
You want to give it a try? Sure, go ahead. It's not like it can get much worse than it already is.=Quer tentar? Claro, pode ir em frente. Não é como se pudesse piorar muito mais do que já está.
Hey! You did it! You actually did it! It's fixed! My sister is going to be so happy when she sees this! Thanks a lot!=Ei! Você fez isso! Você realmente fez! Está consertado! Minha irmã vai ficar tão feliz quando ver isso! Muito obrigado!

Oh man, get a load of this: my friend brought an inappropriate magazine to school, and the student council confiscated it from him. What a dork, right?!=Ah, cara, veja só isso: meu amigo trouxe uma revista inapropriada para a escola, e o conselho estudantil a confiscou dele. Que idiota, né?
Anyway, my friend really wants his magazine back. He knows that he could just sneak into the Student Council room and take it when nobody's around, but he's afraid that somebody will see him.=De qualquer forma, meu amigo realmente quer a revista de volta. Ele sabe que poderia simplesmente se esgueirar para a sala do Conselho Estudantil e pegá-la quando ninguém estiver por perto, mas ele tem medo de que alguém o veja.
So, he's going around and asking people if they would be willing to go into the student council room and steal his magazine back. Haha...man...my friend sure is a dork, isn't he? Ha...haha...=Então, ele está indo por aí perguntando se alguém estaria disposto a entrar na sala do Conselho Estudantil e roubar a revista dele de volta. Haha...cara...meu amigo é mesmo um idiota, não é? Ha...haha...
This student wants a magazine that was confiscated by the Student Council. Go to the Student Council Room on the 2nd floor and retrieve the confiscated magazine.=Este estudante quer uma revista que foi confiscada pelo Conselho Estudantil. Vá até a Sala do Conselho Estudantil no 2º andar e recupere a revista confiscada.

Ugggggh...it's really embarassing to talk about this sort of thing, but...I'm never going to solve this problem on my own, so, ahhhhh, I'm just gonna come right out and say it!=うぐぐ...こういう話をするのは本当に恥ずかしいんだ、けど... 俺一人じゃ絶対に解決できないしなぁ、ああ、言っちまえ！
You know those five tan girls who are always on their phones? I wanna...ask one of them out on a date. But, they all seem to hate me! They avoid me and ignore me whenever I try to talk to them!=いつもスマホを使っている日焼けした女子が5人いるだろ？その中にデートに誘いたい子がいるんだ。でも、みんな俺のことを嫌っているみたいなんだ。話しかけようとしても、みんな俺を避けて、無視しやがる。

I want to ask you something...=聞きたいことがあるんだけど...
Aha - yeah, I've seen him before. The boy with, like, SUPER messy hair, right? Aha, it's ridiculous! He looks like he's never used a comb in his life!=ああー、うん、アイツね。あの髪ボッサボサのキモオタでしょ？まじバカみたい！クシ使ったことないんじゃね？
Oh, do you mean that guy who, like, doesn't know how to stand up straight? Seriously, he's always hunched over like a caveman! He's gonna end up with MAJOR back problems!=ああ、あの姿勢おかしいヤツでしょ？まじでいつも猫背で原始人みたい！絶対に腰痛になるでしょ！
Who's that? Is that one of the boys who wears a bandana? I don't know which one you're talking about, but they look SO goofy with those stupid things on their heads!=誰？バンダナ巻いてるヤツ？誰か知らないけど、あんな変なの巻いてるとかマヌケすぎるよねー！
Are you talking about that guy with all the stubble on his face? He REALLY needs to shave it off. It's like he doesn't even know what razors are for!=あのヒゲ生えてるヤツ？あれまじでヤバいよね！ヒゲ剃りくらい使えって！
Oh. My. God! I KNOW who you're talking about! The boy with GIANT glasses that cover half his face! Why can't he just get contacts like the rest of us?!=もー、まじ、なんなの！あ、アイツか！あの馬鹿みたいにデカいメガネのヤツ！コンタクトぐらいしろって！
...glasses? ...hair? ...posture? ...really?! A bunch of superficial stuff like that?! ...I didn't realize that sort of thing was such a big deal. Anyway, thanks for letting me know. Budoのタスク

My students tell me that they appreciate my lessons, but...I feel like I still have a long way to go before I can consider myself a good teacher. I'm nowhere near as skilled as my former mentor!=教え子たちからはよく感謝されるんだが、いい先生と言えるには、俺はまだまだ未熟な気がするんだ。前の部長に比べたら、まだまだだよ。

Wow! She's a lot more comfortable here than I expected. It was wrong of me to assume that things would be awkward between us; petty grudges are far beneath her! Thank you so much for your help!=思ったより楽しんでくれているようで何よりだ。久しぶりに戻ってきてもらっても気まずいんじゃないかと思っていたが、杞憂だったよ。本当にありがとう。

Recently, the only people I've been sparring with are the other members of the martial arts club. I value the lessons I've learned from them...but I'm worried about something.=最近さ、武道部のみんなとしかスパーリングできてないんだよね。みんなからは色んなことを学んできたけど、少し問題があってね。
I'm starting to fear that if I don't branch out and find new partners to spar with, I'll never learn anything new or grow as a martial artist.=新しいスパーリング相手を見つけないと、新しいことを学べないし、成長できないんじゃないかって思うんだ。
I want to spar with someone who can beat me in combat. If I suffer the agony of defeat, then surely, I will learn where my weaknesses are, and I'll be able to improve as a fighter.=僕を倒せるくらい強い人と戦いたいんだ。負けて悔しい想いをすれば、自分の弱点も分かるし、もっと強くなれそうでしょ？

I see. Don't worry, I won't take it personally.=分かった。気にしないでくれ。

gitaのタスク
